ImageProgram

Class ImageDirectory

  • java.lang.Object
    • ImageProgram.ImageDirectory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class ImageDirectory
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    An ImageDirectory that holds ImageObjects and subDirectories
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • ImageDirectory

        public ImageDirectory(java.io.File folder)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Construct this directory with the filepath of the ImageDirectory.
        Parameters:
        folder: - The File object representing this ImageDirectory's folder on the system.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the folder does not exist on the system or an ImageDirectory of this name already exists

      • ImageDirectory

        public ImageDirectory(java.lang.String filePath)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Construct this directory with the filepath of the ImageDirectory.
        Parameters:
        filePath: - The String representing this ImageDirectory's file path on the system.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the file could not be created

    • Method Detail

      • scan

        public void scan()
          throws java.io.IOException
        Scans this ImageDirectory's folder on the system for images and creates ImageObjects to represent them. Also recursively go through any sub-folders, creating ImageDirectories to represent those if they don't already exist and recursively processing their contents.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the folder already exists or the folder was not able to be changed

      • getFilePath

        public java.lang.String getFilePath()
        Get the name of the file path
        Returns:
        name (String) of the file path

      • setFilePath

        public void setFilePath(java.lang.String newFilePath)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Set the name of the image directory
        Parameters:
        newFilePath: - The new path of the image directory
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the folder already exists or the folder was not able to be changed

      • getImageObjects

        public java.lang.String getImageObjects()
        Returns a String representation of all the Images in this ImageDirectory.
        Returns:
        String Representation of the Images contained within this ImageDirectory.

      • getImageObjectsList

        public java.util.ArrayList<ImageObject> getImageObjectsList()
        Returns the collection of ImageObjects within this directory and its sub-directories.
        Returns:
        All ImageObjects contained within and below this ImageDirectory.

      • getImage

        public ImageObject getImage(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the ImageObject that has the given name, returns null if such an ImageObject does not exist.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the ImageObject.
        Returns:
        The ImageObject.

      • containsImage

        public boolean containsImage(java.lang.String name)
        Returns whether this ImageDirectory containsImage an ImageObject with the given name. Also searches recursively through the sub-directories as well.
        Parameters:
        name - The name to check for.
        Returns:
        The ImageObject with that name.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a String representation of this ImageDirectory containing it's file path, and String representations of all it's ImageObjects. Also iterate through subdirectories recursively and get their String representations
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String representation of this ImageDirectory.
